content:
17. God said that any member of Ahab’s family who died in 
the open country would be 
A. eaten up by the dogs 
B. buried by foreigners 
C. eaten by the birds 
D. left unburied 
 
18. “Take away all iniquity; accept that which is good...” 
what was the iniquity Hosea as referring to in the 
statement above? 
A. Adultery B. Ignorance 
C. Idolatry D. Injustice 
 
19. According to Jeremiah, the role of the shepherds which 
God will give to His people is to 
A. feed the people with knowledge and 
understanding  
B. heal the guilt oe the people 
C. gather the scattered children of Israel 
D. lead them to greener pastures 
 
20. King Nebuchadnezzar assembled the straps, the 
prefects and the governors to 
A. tell him his dream 
B. send them to the provinces 
C. interpret his dream 
D. the dedication of the image 
D. the dedication of the image 
 
21. Where did Elijah kill all the prophets of BAll after, ateh 
contest with Ahab? 
A. Kishon B. Carmel  
C. Zaraphath  D. Cherith 
 
22. “...The fathers have eaten sour grapes,a nd teh 
children’s teeth are set on edge...” 
A. parents are punished for the sins of their 
children 
B. children ar epunished for the sins of their 
parents 
C. parents are punished for the sins of thsier 
granparents  
D. great grandchildren are punished fr the sins 
of their forefathers 
 
23. After Jonah had been thrown into the sea and sea 
ceased from its raging, the men with him 
A. praised the Lord fo saving them 
B. feared teh LORD, offered sacrifice and made 
vows 
C. prayed to God for forgivenss 
D. rowed hard to bring teh shhip back to land 
 
24. Zedekiah, the king o Judah, as captured by teh army of 
the Chaldeans 
A. at Riblah B. in the plains of Jericho 
C. At Arabah D. on the outskirts of Jerusalem 
 
25. Two Christian virtues to be learned in the story of the 
good Samaritan are 
A. kidness and fairness 
B. justice and humility 
C. compassion and humility 
D. comparisson and mercy 
26. ‘ “What have you to do with us O son of God? 
Have you come here to torment us before the 
time? This statement reveals that the demoniacs in 
the country of the Garderenes 
A. recognised the supreme power of Jesus. 
B. wanted to question Jesus’s authority 
C. were threatened by the power of Jesus 
D. did not expect Jesus to come to them at that 
time. 
 
27. According to Luke, the mandate given to the twelve 
at their commissioning was to 
A. rid the entire region of Galilee of evil spirits 
B. preach the gospel to the poor 
C. preach the kingdom of God and heal 
D. go about doing good to all people. 
 
28. According to John, the accusation of the Jews 
levelled against Jesus before Pilate was that He was 
A. an evildoer B. an impostor 
C. a perverter D. a blasphelmer 
 
29. ‘ “ ... Go and learn what this means, ‘I desire mercy 
and not sacrifice’... 
A. Healing of the lepers 
B. Eating with tax collectors 
C. Call of the twelve apostles 
D. Deliverance of the demoniac. 
 
30. Jesus did not go with the centurion to heal his servant 
because he 
A. exhibit great faith 
B. spoke to Jesus as a man under authority 
C. was not worthy for Jesus to come under his 
roof. 
D. was a Gentiles. 
 
31. The disciples celebrated the passover with Jesus be 
cause 
A. He was going to be betrayed by one of them 
B. it was the first day of unleaved bread 
C. they had sacrificed the passover lamb 
D. they wanted to keep the passover feast with 
Him. 
 
32. According to Matthew, true wisdom is 
A. seeking first God’s kingdom and His righteous 
ness. 
B. knowing the truth and doing it at all times 
C. to beware of false prophets and teacher. 
D. obeying fully the ten commandments. 
 
33. The condition Jesus required from Jairus in order to 
heal his daughter was that he should 
A. pray and fast 
B. not fear but believe 
C. put out thosee weeping in the hose 
D. repent and confess his sins. 
 
34. According to Peter’s speech on the day of Pentecost, 
God made Jesus 
A. Lord and King B. holy and mighty 
C. both Lord nd Christ 
D. overcome death and sin.
